j_cumps wrote:

> <controversial>
> 
> I'm still not convinced of the economics of unit testing at the
> lowest level.

As fun as it is to debate controversial topics, until either side of the 
argument can measure the effect of unit testing in some kind of currency 
unit, the whole debate is oratory masturbation. (I had to think about 
that carefully before I typed it.)

The bottom line is that I know I go much, much faster when I have tests 
compared to when I don't. Exactly how much is not something I can say.

> But to my feeling unit testing can be done at the requirements level.

I think you mean what the community calls "story testing". You're 
absolutely right: you can write tests at that level, and many do. I have 
tried living with tests /only/ at that level, and invariably find myself 
wanting to write object-level tests as well.

Take care.
